universalcinema_magazine on July 4, 2024: ".

Did you know? ğŸ¤”

1ï¸âƒ£ Philip K. Dick's Impact: Philip K. Dick's novels have inspired many films like Minority Report and Total Recall. But the most famous adaptation is Ridley Scott's Blade Runner, starring Harrison Ford as Rick Deckard, hunting rogue "replicants."

2ï¸âƒ£ Director's Perspective: Ridley Scott never read the book "Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?" on which Blade Runner is based. He found it too dense! ğŸ“š

3ï¸âƒ£ Author's Reaction: Philip K. Dick initially hated the script but later appreciated the rewrite by David Webb Peoples. ğŸ¬

4ï¸âƒ£ Alternate Endings: The original theatrical ending was happy, using outtakes from Stanley Kubrick's The Shining! ğŸŒ„

5ï¸âƒ£ Audience Reactions: Test audiences hated the movie at first. A voice-over was added, but Harrison Ford wasn't a fan of it. ğŸ¤

6ï¸âƒ£ Deckard's True Identity: Ridley Scott confirmed that Rick Deckard is a replicant. ğŸ¤–

7ï¸âƒ£ The Blade Runner Curse: Companies whose logos appeared in the film, like Atari and Pan Am, faced major business issues soon after. ğŸ“‰

Blade Runner is a sci-fi masterpiece with a fascinating history! What's your favorite fact? ğŸ¤“âœ¨ #BladeRunner #SciFi #FilmTrivia #PhilipKDick #RidleyScott #HarrisonFord #Replicants".
